overview_summary: None of the five neighboring owners have a documented public stance on the proposed development (0 support, 0 oppose, 5 unknown). One couple (the Schofields) stands out with high community influence as a longtime local pastor and family, while the other neighbors have low public profiles and minimal evident influence.

neighbors.name: Curtis Schofield & Clara Schofield
neighbors.claims: Rev. Dr. Curtis R. Schofield, 82, of Flat Rock, was a longtime local minister who passed away in November 2019 ([kwntv7.wixsite.com](https://kwntv7.wixsite.com/discoverdade/post/dr-curtis-schofield#:~:text=Rev,30%2C%202019%20at%20his%20residence)). He had been married to Clara Slater Schofield since 1961, and together they lived in the Flat Rock community for decades ([kwntv7.wixsite.com](https://kwntv7.wixsite.com/discoverdade/post/dr-curtis-schofield#:~:text=Curtis%20R,North%20Georgia%20Conference%20of%20The)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted community figure (e.g. a local pastor or mutual acquaintance) introduce the project to Mrs. Schofield. Emphasize respect for the area’s heritage and reassure how the development can align with the community’s long-term values.

neighbors.name: Austin P. Worley
neighbors.claims: Austin P. Worley is an owner of property in Flat Rock, Jackson County, but no public records indicate he holds any civic office or has taken a public position on local issues ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Members)). His name does not appear in local government or planning meeting minutes reviewed, suggesting a low public profile (no news or civic involvement found).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage informally by reaching out as a neighbor rather than an official. Provide clear, straightforward information about the project and invite questions, as Mr. Worley has no known strong affiliations or preconceptions publicly.

neighbors.name: Aaron Dale Hamlen & Brandi S. Hamlen
neighbors.claims: Brandi S. Hamlen (née Brandi Stephenson) is a family nurse practitioner licensed in nearby Tennessee, with over a decade of medical experience ([www.topnpi.com](https://www.topnpi.com/tn1598272189/dr-brandie-hamlen#:~:text=Mrs,23695)). No evidence was found of Aaron Dale Hamlen holding any public positions or making statements on development; the couple appears to be private landowners without a public civic profile in Jackson County (no mention in local news or records located).

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact them with a data-driven approach, acknowledging Brandi’s professional background. Be prepared to discuss any health, safety, or environmental details of the project factually, and offer to meet at times convenient for their work schedule.

neighbors.name: Mark Oscar Holmen & Amy Ruth Holmen
neighbors.claims: Mark Oscar Holmen and Amy Ruth Holmen own multiple parcels in Flat Rock, but they are not listed in any local government directories or news sources regarding community affairs (no public roles identified) ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Members)). They may be relatively new to the area or simply maintain a low public profile, as no references to them were found in available Jackson County civic records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Introduce yourself and the project with a neighborly tone. Since the Holmens have no known public stance, focus on building trust – perhaps through a casual meeting or open house – and invite them to share any questions or concerns freely.

neighbors.name: Judith A. Peet & Rex Worley
neighbors.claims: Judith A. Peet and Rex Worley jointly own land in Flat Rock; however, they do not appear in local civic records or news, and there is no confirmed public information on their backgrounds or involvement ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Members)). One Judith Peet by this name was noted in Texas in recent years ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/judith-peet-obituary?pid=169411162#:~:text=Judith%20Peet)), raising the possibility that the co-owner(s) might reside outside the immediate community (their local activity is unverified).

approach_recommendations.engage: If contact is needed, approach via formal letter or phone first, as they may not reside in the community full-time. Clearly outline the project benefits and offer to discuss details at their convenience, acknowledging that they might not be closely following local developments.
